verses.verse: Even <S%H1571><s%> <S%H3117>today<s%> is my <S%H7879>complaint<s%> <S%H4805>bitter:<s%> my <S%H3027>stroke<s%> is <S%H3513>heavier<s%> <S%H5921>than<s%> my <S%H585>groaning.<s%>
Oh <S%H4310>that<s%> <S%H5414><s%> I <S%H3045>knew<s%> where I might <S%H4672>find<s%> him! that I might <S%H935>come<s%> even <S%H5704>to<s%> his <S%H8499>seat!<s%>
I would <S%H6186>order<s%> my <S%H4941>cause<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> him, and <S%H4390>fill<s%> my <S%H6310>mouth<s%> with <S%H8433>arguments.<s%>
I would <S%H3045>know<s%> the <S%H4405>words<s%> which he would <S%H6030>answer<s%> me, and <S%H995>understand<s%> <S%H4100>what<s%> he would <S%H559>say<s%> unto me.
Will he <S%H7378>plead<s%> <S%H5978>against<s%> me with his <S%H7230>great<s%> <S%H3581>power?<s%> <S%H3808>No;<s%> <S%H389>but<s%> <S%H1931>he<s%> would <S%H7760>put<s%> strength in me.
There <S%H8033><s%> the <S%H3477>righteous<s%> might <S%H3198>dispute<s%> <S%H5973>with<s%> him; so should I be <S%H6403>delivered<s%> <S%H5331>forever<s%> from my <S%H4480>judge.<s%> <S%H8199><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I <S%H1980>go<s%> <S%H6924>forward,<s%> but he is <S%H369>not<s%> there; and <S%H268>backward,<s%> but I <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H995>perceive<s%> him:

On the left <S%H8040>hand,<s%> where he doth <S%H6213>work,<s%> but I <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H2372>behold<s%> him: he <S%H5848>hideth<s%> himself on the right <S%H3225>hand,<s%> that I <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H7200>see<s%> him:
But <S%H3588><s%> he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> the <S%H1870>way<s%> that I <S%H5978>take:<s%> when he hath <S%H974>tried<s%> me, I shall come <S%H3318>forth<s%> as <S%H2091>gold.<s%>
My <S%H7272>foot<s%> hath <S%H270>held<s%> his <S%H838>steps,<s%> his <S%H1870>way<s%> have I <S%H8104>kept,<s%> and <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H5186>declined.<s%>

Neither <S%H3808><s%> have I gone <S%H4185>back<s%> from the <S%H4687>commandment<s%> of his <S%H8193>lips;<s%> I have <S%H6845>esteemed<s%> the <S%H561>words<s%> of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> more than my <S%H4480>necessary<s%> <S%H2706><s%> food.
But <S%H1931>he<s%> is in <S%H259>one<s%> mind, and <S%H4310>who<s%> can <S%H7725>turn<s%> him? and what his <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H183>desireth,<s%> even that he <S%H6213>doeth.<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> he <S%H7999>performeth<s%> the thing that is <S%H2706>appointed<s%> for me: and <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H2007>such<s%> things are <S%H5973>with<s%> him.
Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> am I <S%H926>troubled<s%> at his <S%H4480>presence:<s%> <S%H6440><s%> when I <S%H995>consider,<s%> I am <S%H6342>afraid<s%> <S%H4480>of<s%> him.
For <S%H410>God<s%> maketh my heart <S%H7401>soft<s%> <S%H3820><s%> and the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> <S%H926>troubleth<s%> me:

Because <S%H3588><s%> I was <S%H3808>not<s%> cut <S%H6789>off<s%> <S%H4480>before<s%> <S%H6440><s%> the <S%H2822>darkness,<s%> neither hath he <S%H3680>covered<s%> the <S%H652>darkness<s%> from my <S%H4480>face.<s%> <S%H6440><s%>
